job_title: Residential Support Staff in Boise, ID
pros: Terry Reilly is Community oriented to provide much needed Medical, Dental and Behavioral health services to all members of the community. I was pleased to be part of the New Path Community Housing team in helping chronically homeless people into housing while providing the supportive services needed for the transition
cons: Really no cons. The only reason I left the job was because it was the start of the pandemic, before vaccines, and the risk to my own health.

pros: Terry Reilly is dedicated to the underserved and fully believes in their mission.
cons: Each department is different. I found the Accounting/Finance department struggles with work/life balance. To many tasks to do with not enough time to get them completed. Dare to bring this up to management and you will not be heard or dismissed.

review_title: Excellent Organization with strong sense of mission
job_title: Director of Business Management in Nampa, ID
pros:
The organization has a strong mission and sense of purpose to provide Healthcare For All.
The leadership team and the roster of providers have long tenure with the organization.
It is a rewarding experience to serve the patients and clients who face challenges to access healthcare.
Terry Reilly is often engaged in developing and deploying new methods of delivering healthcare. It is a very innovative environment.
Time Off Plan and Benefits package are very generous.
cons: Like many healthcare settings, staffing shortages can make the work environment hectic at times.

job_title: Physician Assistant, PA-C in Nampa, ID
pros: schedule is 4 10's with minimal Saturday coverage (3-4x yr)
cons: Leadership is fraught incompetence, they rely on the "incident ticket" which is simply just a way for an employee to complain about another employee regardless of the situation.

pros:
The mission stated from its founding is service-centered and much needed. 
Anyone wanting to serve the community would get ample opportunity here. There's a higher chance of working with like-minded individuals who also want to serve their community.
cons: The budget is limited and there could be fierce competition for full-time work and access to benefits. The workload can be overwhelming.

job_title: Patient Access Specialist in Nampa, ID

pros: The history and mission of the non-profit health care centers is more incredible than I imagined prior to working there. The people there are all amazing, hardworking, loving people!
cons: As with many non-profit businesses in the healthcare field, there are always changes to policy and practice in order to improve service or efficiency. This was not necessarily a con for me because I flow well with change in the work place but many people seemed to find it frustrating.

pros: They provide great medical and dental service to a diverse ethnic group that have economical challenges.
cons: Over work staff with very little pay.

job_title: Family Nurse Practitioner in Meridian, ID
pros: The patients are usually very appreciative of what we do, and most of the employees are very caring and choose to work there.
cons: I don’t think the pay is all that great, but I’m not sure how it compares to other similar community clinics.

review_title: Great pay & benefits, but management sucks
job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Caldwell, ID
pros: Benefits are awesome, good salary for the position, providers are caring and very understanding
cons: Extremely busy, management kind of sucks, demanding patients
